reviews.title: Liked the church service
reviews.text: Stayed there for a week with my girlfriend. We enjoyed the water sports organised by the hotel. They were kind enough to organise rent of 2 jetski's so that we could enjoy the day having fun.

reviews.title: Never go back to Aggies
reviews.text: Liked the room service! Club sandwiches were cool.
All round good service and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Aggie's is OK
Satisfy your need for western comforts in Samoa

reviews.text: First of all, let me just say this place is iconic to Samoa. We based our choice of this hotel almost 90% on just that fact.
reviews.title: Vacation in Paradise!

reviews.text: I am sure glad that our expectations were met with the fact that this is the premier hotel resort in Apia, Samoa. The staff is great! They obviously had great training because from the moment you arrive till the time you leave to all the room service and restaurants in between, you are treated with some of the best service I have experienced. With the exception of the Ritz-Carlton in San Francisco, never have I felt so catered to than at Aggie's (which it is known as by the locals).
reviews.title: Loved Aggie's and the staff

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful. We opted to stay in one of the Family Fale/Bungalows. I can say this was definitely a good choice. Our relatives that traveled with us stayed in the newer deluxe wing, which was nice as well, but didn't have that full tropical/island effect that the bungalow/fale had. The room was beautifully constructed the old Samoan way. It was also nice because each one has its own porch/patio to sit out on in the evenings and enjoy the music coming from the main restaurant or just watch the rain fall on one of the warm tropical nights.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, friendly management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kids really enjoyed the pool area and it is open late so we were able to take a dip after dinner and right before bed. The restaurant is extremely well-staffed and they attend to your every need. The Samoan cuisine is an acquired taste but the food was delectable! The atmosphere was so inviting with the live music and on certain nights even live dancing.
reviews.title: A piece of history - well worth the stay!

likes.liked: — Close proximity to town, and it being a piece of Pacific history!
likes.disliked: — Quite pricey for what it is, sometimes service can be slow, but that's often just the Samoan way!

reviews.text: It is close to everything in town but you will have to rent a car in order to really experience the island. A tip is to drive to the village of Lalomanu for the best beach on island or take a short ferry over to Savai'i for some of the best beaches in the world! The drivers out there are a little crazy so be careful. They don't really have any rhyme or reason to the way they drive so always be on the defensive when at the wheel.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: I stayed at Aggie Greys with friends in July. Two out of the three of our group are Samoan and one of our group can speak fluent Samoan. The staff there seemed oblivious to the fact that my friend could actually understand what they were saying. Not only were their comments offensive but they were also demeaning to women. When we made a complaint to the manager, we were not taken seriously at all. Also...after the complaint was made the service became increasingly worse, to the point where the staff did not give me the wake up call that I had asked for and then subsequently I almost missed my cousins wedding. On my return to Samoa in 2006, I opted to go to the Tusitala instead and found their service to be 100% better.
reviews.title: Beware of staff comments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our holiday at Aggie Greys. The staff were incredibly courteous and helpful, very respectful of 'do not disturb' signs when we needed a sleep in and no request was too difficult. The food was fine - especially on buffet nights - and very reasonable in comparison with similar menus in Australia. There is a supermarket just down the road near Green Turtle tours where you can pick up incidentals like soft drink, chips, peanuts and grocery lines - and includes a great bakery with creambuns, bread, donuts etc for the kids. The staff of the tour desk were very helpful and pleasant and tour prices reasonable - approx 75 AUD for a full day trip with lunch. Security was very good with safety deposit boxes in the rooms and in reception. Don't miss the fia fia night!! We'll be back for longer next year.
reviews.title: A Terrific Stay

likes.liked: — Staff and atmosphere, reasonable cost, location

reviews.text: We were disappointed generally with aggie greys.
reviews.title: Not as good as we were hoping

reviews.text: We stayed in a family room, they are quite old and rundown and the bathrooms are not very clean. You don't want to spend to much time in them.
reviews.title: Best in town, but expensive
Loved Aggie Greys
reviews.text: We were woken at 8:30 every morning with a knock on the door so they could clean the room ( Not great when you arrive at 3am), They just didn't seem to get the idea we were trying to have a holiday.

We stayed in a garden room which is really just a kind of a motel out the back of the real colonial building that has made Aggies famous. The room was fine but a bit like being in a fish bowl; there was no privacy unless the curtains were closed. The shower though was the best I had in Samoa. The pool is also very good.
reviews.title: A pleasant experience
We loved it here and will be back for sure!!!
reviews.text: FiaFia night and Samon buffet were very good, $65 (tala) per person which is quite a lot but a good entertaining night and delicious food. On the whole, the food here was some of the best we had in Samoa.

reviews.title: Very Friendly and homely feel
reviews.text: Staff were mostly helpful and courteuous, some of the waiters lacked sufficient English skills for the job but did their best. Reception staff service was mixed; we received a very disinterested and disorganised welcome but when we left, they were kind enough to let us check out at 11pm for our late airport transfer at no extra charge. That was absolutely brilliant and made such a difference to our last day there being able to use the room still.

reviews.title: Average to Below standard
reviews.text: Highly recommend the marine reserve only 10 min walk away for brilliant snorkelling.

reviews.title: Great getaway! Totally relaxed now. :-)
reviews.text: Everything here was great from our Samoan fale to the food and service. We'll be staying here again next time.
